thread.title: Australian Twitter staffers face the axe
thread.title_full: Australian Twitter staffers face the axe

title: Australian Twitter staffers face the axe
text:
Thu, Oct 15, 2015, 6:18 PM AEDT - Australia Markets closed Australian Twitter staffers face the axe AAP â€“ 1 hour 30 minutes ago Recommend View Photo 

One of Twitter Australia's most senior executives has been axed as the social media company cuts staff numbers around the globe. 
News and government partnerships manager Flip Prior confirmed in a tweet on Thursday that she was one of the 336 workers to made redundant. 
"Sad to say that my days at Twitter are coming to an end due to global events More info soon. I'll miss all my excellent partners! DM Qs" Ms Prior said. 
The cuts, eight per cent of the company's workforce, will come mostly from the product and engineering departments. 
In a letter to employees, Twitter's newly re-installed global chief executive Jack Dorsey said the cuts were necessary for the company to implement significant structural changes that will "reflect our plan ahead". 
"This isn't easy. But it is right," he said. 
"The world needs a strong Twitter, and this is another step to get there." 
Twitter's Australian office did not want to say how many of its staff members will be affected by the redundancies when contacted by AAP. 
However a spokesman confirmed the company's board of directors had approved the restructuring. 
The redundancies come as Twitter attempts to expand its user base. 
With only 316 million monthly active users, compared to Facebook's and Instagram's combined 1.4 billion users, Twitter has struggled to entice new users and retain existing ones. 
As part of its growth strategy, Twitter introduced a new option on its platform last week called `moments' that allows users to see the best of what's trending on Twitter. 
It is the first stage of the company's growth plan, Mr Dorsey said. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
